text: I am so happy with this little pool!  I bought this for my puppy to cool off in the summer and he loves it.  It's super durable, folds easily for storage and is just a great pool for the money.  It definitely beats the molded plastic ones for ease of use, storage and draining.  You will NOT be disappointed with this pool.
title: Great pool!
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on June 4, 2024

text: This is my honest review of the pool. I waited about three months before reviewing this item. I bought the 4 XL and this pool is 100% durable. I have two large dogs that love to jump in the pool to fetch their balls. I also have multiple young grandchildren that use this pool almost on a daily basis. And three months of daily use this pool shows absolutely no wear and tear. I love that it comes with a drainage plug and is easy to fold up and just throw in a corner of the yard when I’m not using it.  I do move it to different spots in the yard around every two days just so it doesn’t kill the grass underneath. After experimenting with different types of pools for the dogs to use in the summer, they never held up so I would buy this pool 100 times over. Even though this is a collapsible pool, the sides are 100% sturdy and has held up to the little ones sometimes sitting on the edges. The bottom of a pool is a really thick material that has held up to my dogs nails beautifully. I didn’t realize that this pool pool also came in 16 inch deep instead of 12 so next year I would like to buy that one but honestly, I can’t even justify it because this pool is still in such great condition. I don’t leave many reviews, but I feel strongly that this is 100% worth the price for durability.
title: Great for dogs and small children.
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on July 22, 2024

text: I have a Great Dane/ pit and he loves the water. Every year we start out with a plastic kiddie and he loves them. This year I wanted something I could enjoy too so I decided to spend the money and purchase this pool and boy it didn’t disappoint. Very easy to set up - you LITERALLY take it out of the box, unfold it and fill it up. The material is very thick and seems like it will last a good while. It’s very easy to clean - we just empty it, spray it off and put it in the shed. I read so many reviews to see if I wanted to order and I say just do it!! If you have a dog that loves water, you will NOT regret it. The price is so worth it and it’s very portable and easy to love. Just do it! Your dog will thank you and have the most fun time!
title: My dog is OBSESSED & so am I!
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on June 1, 2024

text: We have a 90lb Pitbull Lab mix who is absolutely in love with this!Easy to set up and drain.Material is durable.I can see it lasting a summer or two with how crazy our dogs is lolIt is a bit floopy so not as sturdy as I thought it would be. But it gets the job done!! Would definitely order it again!
title: Great for the price!
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on June 14, 2024

text: This product is truly a hidden gem! I don’t know why I didn’t think to purchase a foldable pool before this. Much more convenient than a kiddieblow up pool, as no pump or hours of blowing required, and you don’t have to deflate it or leave it open when you’re done- just simply empty and fold. It is sturdy. It fits my two kids (6 years old and 2 years old) plus me OR my husband. Even though this is advertised as a dog pool, we do NOT have pets. I got the XL size. Perfect for a hot day in the backyard. It does NOT come with a storage case but we are able to fold it and slip it right back into the plastic bag it came in. A garbage bag would do the job as well.
title: Hidden Gem!
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on July 25, 2024

text: I have a German shepherd mix and this is the perfect pool for him. He can get his zoomies, splash in the pool, and keep zooming. It’s easy to clean, durable, easy to drain, and easy to collapse and store. This is the second time I’ve bought this product, and I’d buy it again.
title: Perfect splash pool for the dog!
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on July 25, 2024

Great product, I couldn’t be happier and my fur babies agree!
title: Exactly as advertised AND reviewed!

text: Use this for my 8 ducks. They love the depth of the pool and the size. The bottom did get punctured, but was quickly fixed with a vinyl patch. Back in business! My only complaint is how heavy it is to lift to clean out.
title: Great Size for Ducks
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on June 19, 2024

text: I live in Central Massachusetts , I  adopted a Lab/hound cross, hoping she would love the water, i first bought a cheap round kiddie pool from family dollar, SHE LOVED this thing with a bit of encouragement, so about 2 weeks later i discovered this on Amazon, i figured ok for the price why not. It seems durable the drain plug is a joke, at first I didnt think it would open, but it did, will it last longer than the pool?? Anyway my marley had a BLAST, come time to drain it again  A PAIN,  so what I dd was i got all the water out a bit of dirt from her running back and forth and jumping in the pool, My advice, wash it out after you drain it if you have that small plastic kiddie pool put that down first and put this pool over it it supports it til its used the next time. i figue if i get 3 more uses out of this with the CHEAP DRAIN PLUG, I'M happy. Make sure your dogs nails are trimmed back, with no sharp edges, other than that this is my review
title: ALL IS GOOD, DO NOT LIKE THE CHEAP DRAIN PLUG
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on June 26, 2024

text: So I was tired of blow up pools mostly taking them down. This foldable one is easy to take down and fold back up. My 2 yr old has plenty of room to have fun.Leaving it up all weekend it will have a film at the bottom. Put some dish soap, scrub then rinse. Foldable pools are the way to go!
title: Easy set up and take down
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on July 24, 2024

text: Well, first, don't be fooled by the ad photos showing kids and dogs pasted into the image, okay?  Those photos wouldn't fool a child.  Seriously, look at the photos.  They are so phony.That said, the product arrives well-packed.  It's easy to unfold...there's really no set up required.  It might help to set it on a spot that has a very slight downward slope to it, after making sure the drain hole is closed and pointing towards the downward side.  Then just fill it with water and let the fun begin.  Right?  That's about as far as "easy" goes.When it's time to drain the pool, just open the drain plug and let it drain.  This pool will NOT drain completely just by opening the hole.  You're going to have to juggle it a bit, lifting it up on one side to get the rest of the water to (hopefully) drain.  But it probably won't.  Frankly, the only way to get all the water out is to lift it up and turn it upside down, and just let it sit there a while.  Ditto for getting rid of all the grass, twigs, dog hair, dirt, and dead bugs that accumulate in this pool.  This isn't the pool's fault...it's just what's gonna happen if you use it.  You'll need to hose down the inside of the pool.  You don't want your kids and dogs playing in muddy brown water.My end advice is to buy the largest size offered.  It may be a bit harder to empty and clean, but the extra room offsets the higher price.I can't comment on its sturdiness.  I have two Rottweilers.  They love it and haven't torn it up yet.  Have to wait and see how it holds up for three months or so.Most of these types of "kiddie pools"  are more or less the same.  You see one, you've seen 'em all.  They need to be larger and deeper for your big dogs to get the full benefit.This is something I'll use for my dogs for one summer, then fold it up and put it in the recycle bin.
title: Not Quite All It's Cracked Up To Be
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on June 24, 2024

text: I bought this pool for my pups about 1 month & 1/2 ago to prepare for the summer heat where we live.Super durable, easy to install, easy to put away and great to bathe your pups in during the summer.Just one important note, if you do leave this out in the hot sun let it cool off. It does get super hot!Image that I attached sitting out to get some sun in to bathe one of my pups later :-)I would totally recommend this product if you are looking to get a pool for yourself, kiddos or pups!
title: Pups love their pool
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on July 7, 2024

I've not had to drain it, but it looks easy enough.  Already today my 4 year old has taken me to the back door multiple times to "splash".  I think this was a WIN!

The color got faded because I add chlorine to the water.I have an 85lb German Shepherd and I do not worry at all about her damaging it.     Got this for our pitties first birthday! He absolutely loves it he popped the dollar store plastic one we got first so we had to upgrade to this, and it was 1000% worth it! He likes to DIG for his toys in the water so we needed a tear proof pool and this is that! The size is nice, I wish it was a tad taller but it’s perfect for him to jump in and out of, super easy to clean, we haven’t folded it up yet but it seems very easy!
title: Love it!
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on July 25, 2024

text: So easy to set up and keep clean.  My pups love it!

text: Purchased the 80 inch pool. Super easy to set up, the quality is great for the price. The sides stand up unassisted, even without water. It's about a foot in depth, dark blue in color. My kids have a so much fun with it!

text: Might have to come back at the end of the season to see how it does overall, BUT so far I’m thrilled! Every spring for the last 8 years I’ve bought two large plastic pools for my Aussies, this year those plastic pools have more then doubled in cost (where I live) $40 for two large plastic pools or $46 for something new. I decided to go with this and see how it goes, so far I feel it’s rather safe for children and they can put ALL their toys in it, while having the dog in there and still have tons of room to play. I ended up getting the cover as well, and that could handle my large goat and baby goat walking on it, trying to find the water. My aussies scratched in the bottom to get a ball and so far no holes, no problems at all. So easy to clean, it’s not slippery, dried fast (I live in the desert so not sure that says much). Can roll it up and take it everywhere. I’m really loving it so far! I’d definitely recommend.
title: What a great pool!
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on April 22, 2024
